description: Claire Reynolds is an aspiring young reporter working on a story that could be her big break: Justin Deville, a millionaire businessman rumored to be involved in prostitution and an underground SM club, has been connected with the...
name: Dark Secrets

review.name: A Newspaper Journalist in Pursuit of a Murder Suspect
review.reviewBody: This film essentially begins with reports that a young model named "Nancy Boyer" (Chanda) has mysteriously gone missing and it's believed that a millionaire by the name of "Justin Deville" (Justin Carroll) was somehow involved in her abduction and murder. Recognizing a story when she hears one, a newspaper journalist named "Claire Reynolds" (Monique Parent) decides to go undercover and infiltrate Justin's private circle of friends and associates to get closer to him. What she doesn't count on, however, is the twisted lifestyle she will have to deal with along the way. Now, rather than reveal any more, I will just say that this could have been an okay film if it hadn't had an extremely noticeable flaw at the start in which Justin Carroll seemed to mumble his lines in a rather incoherent manner. So, either he needs to hire a vocal coach or the Boom Operator (David Cook) needs to find a new line of work. One or the other. Likewise, although I didn't especially care for some of the erotic scenes, I thought that both Monique Parent and Julie Strain (as "Mauri") performed well enough-all things considered. Be that as it may, I have to say that I just wasn't impressed with this movie and I have rated it accordingly. Below average.

trailer.name: Dark Secrets
